page.title: 03 RUGBY LEAGUE IN HULL
page.content:
The city of Hull is famous for its two rugby teams. Their names are Hull FC and Hull Kingston Rovers. Hull FC have a reputation for good support in the world of rugby league. They have an average gate of around 10,000. Hull KR's is around 8,500. This 1984-85 season has been good for Hull KR for they have won the League Championship Cup and the John Player Trophy and being runners up in the Yorkshire Cup and the Premiership Trophy.
With such large support rugby league is obviously very important to Hull people. The reason for its popularity is to a large extent historical and partly because it is introduced at the early age of ten in many schools. It seems a self generating system.
